goal.core.agent

Class AbstractAgentFactory<D extends Debugger,C extends GOALInterpreter<D>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.agent.AbstractAgentFactory<D,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - class of the Debugger to provide.
    C - class of the GOALInterpreter to provide.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AgentFactory<D,C>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    IDEAgentFactory

    public abstract class AbstractAgentFactory<D extends Debugger,C extends GOALInterpreter<D>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements AgentFactory<D,C>
    Abstract base for building Agents. Subclasses can provide different Messaging- and EnvironmentCapabilities, Debuggers, Learners and Controllers. This can be done by overriding or implementing the proper methods. During the construction the class fields will be initialized to assist the creation of different classes. When extending this class and providing constructor withouth messaging subclasses classes should be aware that messageBoxId and messageBox fields are null when building agents. The provideMessagingCapabilities method should be overridden accordingly. It might happen that multiple agents are constructed at the same time. Therefore this class should be thread safe. #2953
    Author:
    mpkorstanje

    • Method Detail

      • build

        public Agent<C> build(GOALProgram program,
             java.io.File programFile,
             java.lang.String agentBaseName,
             EnvironmentPort environment)
                                          throws nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException,
                                                 KRInitFailedException
        Description copied from interface: AgentFactory
        Builds an Agent. Before throwing an exception upwards all clean up should have been done.
        Specified by:
        build in interface AgentFactory<D extends Debugger,C extends GOALInterpreter<D>>
        Parameters:
        program - the agent executes
        programFile - containing the agents program ()
        agentBaseName - base name for the agent. This name does not need to be unique.
        environment - in which the agent should be launched. May be null when no environment is available.
        Returns:
        a new agent.
        Throws:
        nl.tudelft.goal.messaging.exceptions.MessagingException - thrown when the agent could not setup a MessageBox
        KRInitFailedException - thrown when the agent could not initialize the KRlanguage.
